body.p: The STS supports SNMP over its Ethernet connection. The STS sends a single trap, a summary alarm, if any alarm condition is raised on the STS. Touch the SNMP button on the Home Screen to display the SNMP Screen (). Touch MORE to display additional buttons if SNMP button doesnâ€™t show.
The SNMP screen is used to setup sending a summary alarm SNMP trap to Management Stations or Contacts. A summary alarm trap is the only trap presented.

li.p: Touch the Trap button to display the Keyboard Screen to set the IP address of the Management Station.
Touch the Contact button to display the Keyboard Screen to set the name of the contact person who will be receiving the traps. The contact can be a group name recognized by your email system.
Touch Name button to display the Keyboard Screen to enter the name or designation of theSTS.
Touch Location to display the Keyboard Screen to set the physical location of the STS.
Touch Send SNMP Traps to toggle the between a green check mark (OK to send traps) and red X (do not send traps).

body.p: The STS 2000A supports SNMP Version 1. Supported SNMP message types are Get and GetNext.

The SNMP MIB is available on the Eaton PDI website. Eaton PDI Static Transfer Switch https://www.eaton.com/us/en-us/catalog/backup-power-ups-surge-it-power-distribution/eaton-pdi-static-transfer-switch.resources.html
You can also have the MIB emailed to you by Eaton Service (1-800-843-9433).
